channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14115] Fix resource leak in HMasterCommandLine
item.description:
In HMasterCommandLine#stopMaster(), admin is not closed.

HMasterCommandLine.java

try (Connection connection = ConnectionFactory.createConnection(conf)) {

      try (Admin admin = connection.getAdmin()) {

        connection.getAdmin().shutdown();

      } catch (Throwable t) {

        LOG.error("Failed to stop master", t);

        return 1;

      }

    }

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

against master branch at commit 834f87b23de533783ba5f5b858327a6164f17f55.

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.0 2.4.1 2.5.0 2.5.1 2.5.2 2.6.0 2.7.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #6670 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/6670/)
HBASE-14115 Fix resource leak in HMasterCommandLine (Yuhao Bi) (tedyu: rev 5ec5552be0534dbf4b07ef6607741ae6f9ab0495)

  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/HMasterCommandLine.java

Hi Ted,
I've figure out this is come out from HBASE-13322,
which only pushed to the trunk for now.

Thanks for the review.
Yuhao.

In branch-1, we have:


    Admin adm = null;

The adm is never explicitly closed.

Can you attach a patch to fix that ?

Thanks

You are right, adm.shutdown() is not in the finally block.
Here comes the patch.

Thanks.

shutdown() call can be in try block.
What I meant was that the close of adm should be in finally block.

What do you think ?
